analyzeResult.content:
JR
Inter-office Memorandum
TO: Dr. D. H. Piehl
RE: Five-Week Highlights
FROM: J. P. Wheeler, Manager Component Technology
DATE: January 4, 1983
PACKAGE TECHNOLOGY
1) Retail 12's Cigarette Package:
Due to. problems encountered with vending the current 12's soft package, Marketing has requested a high priority effort be devoted to developing a package which can be used in the three major types of vending machines. Once prototype designs have been developed, samples will be taken into the field for testing and evaluation.
2) PF Project:
Efforts are being made to determine what packaging requirements are needed to automatically tax stamp a 94 mm length product in a crush proof box. Production of this product is to begin in late March or early April, therefore, Marketing is most anxious that any tax stamping problems be resolved as quickly as possible.
3) Cigarette Package Innerliner:
. A test was conducted on Hercules .00025 foil/opaque polypropylene innerliner for cigarette packages. Initial testing required an air-resist manifold, made by Hercules, which improved the feed characteristics. Laboratory tests will continue to confirm any benefits of the new structure.
. A test was conducted on Golden Belt's printed (no foil) innerliner. This ran well in the R&D plant. Moisture loss and odor tests are underway.
4) Wrapping Materials Machinability:
Ten pallets of Miquel y Costas 719 cigarette paper were evaluated successfully at Whitaker Park with no split ends. This paper will be used as an alternate source of supply when qualified.
ADHESIVE TECHNOLOGY
5) Cigarette Seam Adhesive Mixup:
In view of two recent incidents of open-head drums of adhesive being mistaken for 1230 cigarette seam adhesive, we have instigated a new policy which requires factories to use seam adhesive in distinctive blue plastic closed head drums. The adhesive is pumped from drums directly into the seam adhesive tank, thus reducing the chance for adhesive mismatch. Use of seam adhesive other than the 1230 seam adhesive requires that the product be sent to reclaim.
50313 5252

lines.content: JR
Inter-office Memorandum
TO: Dr. D. H. Piehl
RE:
Five-Week Highlights
FROM: J. P. Wheeler, Manager
Component Technology
DATE: January 4, 1983
PACKAGE TECHNOLOGY
Retail 12's Cigarette Package:
Due to. problems encountered with vending the current 12's soft package, Marketing
has requested a high priority effort be devoted to developing a package which can be
used in the three major types of vending machines. Once prototype designs have been
developed, samples will be taken into the field for testing and evaluation.
PF Project:
Efforts are being made to determine what packaging requirements are needed to
automatically tax stamp a 94 mm length product in a crush proof box. Production of
this product is to begin in late March or early April, therefore, Marketing is most
anxious that any tax stamping problems be resolved as quickly as possible.
Cigarette Package Innerliner:
. A test was conducted on Hercules .00025 foil/opaque polypropylene innerliner for
cigarette packages. Initial testing required an air-resist manifold, made by
Hercules, which improved the feed characteristics. Laboratory tests will
continue to confirm any benefits of the new structure.
. A test was conducted on Golden Belt's printed (no foil) innerliner. This ran
well in the R&D plant. Moisture loss and odor tests are underway.
Wrapping Materials Machinability:
Ten pallets of Miquel y Costas 719 cigarette paper were evaluated successfully at
Whitaker Park with no split ends. This paper will be used as an alternate source of
supply when qualified.
ADHESIVE TECHNOLOGY
Cigarette Seam Adhesive Mixup:
In view of two recent incidents of open-head drums of adhesive being mistaken for
1230 cigarette seam adhesive, we have instigated a new policy which requires
factories to use seam adhesive in distinctive blue plastic closed head drums. The
adhesive is pumped from drums directly into the seam adhesive tank, thus reducing
the chance for adhesive mismatch. Use of seam adhesive other than the 1230 seam
adhesive requires that the product be sent to reclaim.

paragraphs.content: FROM: J. P. Wheeler, Manager Component Technology

Due to. problems encountered with vending the current 12's soft package, Marketing has requested a high priority effort be devoted to developing a package which can be used in the three major types of vending machines. Once prototype designs have been developed, samples will be taken into the field for testing and evaluation.

Efforts are being made to determine what packaging requirements are needed to automatically tax stamp a 94 mm length product in a crush proof box. Production of this product is to begin in late March or early April, therefore, Marketing is most anxious that any tax stamping problems be resolved as quickly as possible.

. A test was conducted on Hercules .00025 foil/opaque polypropylene innerliner for cigarette packages. Initial testing required an air-resist manifold, made by Hercules, which improved the feed characteristics. Laboratory tests will continue to confirm any benefits of the new structure.
. A test was conducted on Golden Belt's printed (no foil) innerliner. This ran well in the R&D plant. Moisture loss and odor tests are underway.
Ten pallets of Miquel y Costas 719 cigarette paper were evaluated successfully at Whitaker Park with no split ends. This paper will be used as an alternate source of supply when qualified.

In view of two recent incidents of open-head drums of adhesive being mistaken for 1230 cigarette seam adhesive, we have instigated a new policy which requires factories to use seam adhesive in distinctive blue plastic closed head drums. The adhesive is pumped from drums directly into the seam adhesive tank, thus reducing the chance for adhesive mismatch. Use of seam adhesive other than the 1230 seam adhesive requires that the product be sent to reclaim.
